meanings.definition: A building or room where goods or services are sold.
meanings.sent1: I went to the shop to buy some candy.
meanings.sent2: The shop on the corner sells fresh bread every morning.
meanings.sent3: The shop was so crowded that I couldn't even see the shelves properly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a shop of memories, each item holding a different moment.
meanings.sent5: The shop smelled of freshly baked cookies, drawing customers in from the street.

meanings.definition: To visit a store or stores to browse or buy goods.
meanings.sent1: Let's shop for new shoes this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She likes to shop for clothes online.
meanings.sent3: I shop for groceries every Sunday like it's a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: His eyes shop the shelves, searching for the perfect gift.
meanings.sent5: We shop for bargains at the flea market every month.

meanings.definition: To work at a trade or craft.
meanings.sent1: He learned to shop wood to create beautiful furniture.
meanings.sent2: She shops jewelry as a hobby and sells her creations online.
meanings.sent3: The baker shops the dough with precision, creating perfect loaves every time.
meanings.sent4: His words are carefully shopped to craft compelling stories.
meanings.sent5: The artist shops clay into intricate sculptures, each piece unique and stunning.
